communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Any record reflecting any request for "guidance from the FLDOE" referenced in President Williams' January 11, 2023 memo to Chancellor Hebda, and any record reflecting any "guidance" received.

2) Any agenda for, minutes of, audio or video recordings (including Zoom recordings) of, or notes taken at any of the following meetings:
(a) a meeting on December 14, 2022  of the Council of Presidents
(b) a meeting on January 4, 2023 with Chancellor Hebda on the one hand and any member of the Council of Presidents (including President Williams) on the other;
(c) a meeting on January 5, 2023 between President Williams and Florida College System presidents, as referenced in President Williams' January 6, 2023 email with the subject line "Executive Order Framework";
(d) a meeting on January 17, 2023 at or about 6:30 p.m. with Chancellor Hebda on the one hand and any member of the Council of Presidents (including President Williams) on the other;
(e) the COP Professional Development meeting held on or about January 18, 2023;
(f) a coordination call held on February 2, 2023 by the Moore Agency. This meeting may have been attended by persons employed within the college's media/public relations staff.

3) Any copy of remarks presented (or talking points, notes, or similar preparatory materials) by President Williams at the February 1, 2023 faculty assembly.

4) Any emails (including attachments) sent to or from Williams.Tonjua@spcollege.edu which contain any of the "SEARCH TERMS" identified below. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2022.

5) Any emails (including attachments) sent (on or after November 1, 2022) to, from, or between Williams.Tonjua@spcollege.edu, on the one hand, and any of the following addresses, on the other hand: agarciafalconetti@polk.edu, parkera@palmbeachstate.edu, probstc@scf.edu, cflax-hyman@gulfcoast.edu, dstephenson@nwfsc.edu, emeadows@pensacolastate.edu, lorenzg@seminolestate.edu, ghaile@broward.edu, BigardH@LSSC.EDU, henningj@cf.edu, richeyj@easternflorida.edu, jdudley1@fsw.edu, MURDAUGJ@tcc.fl.edu, joepickens@sjrstate.edu, John.Avendano@fscj.edu, grosskopfj@nfcc.edu, Jonathan.gueverra@cfk.edu, Katwater@hccfl.edu, kplinske@valenciacollege.edu, lawrence.barrett@fgc.edu, mpumarie@mdc.edu, Paul.broadie@sfcollege.edu, CLEMMONSS@chipola.edu, thomas.leitzel@southflorida.edu, timmoore@irsc.edu, beardt@phsc.edu, tlobasst@daytonastate.edu, Kathy.Hebda@fldoe.org, or Henry.Mack@fldoe.org

6) Any draft of the FCS Presidents Statement (also known as the "COP Statement on HB 7") issued on or about January 18, 2023.  This includes copies of any draft circulated by email and any Word version (including any redline version) sent to or from President Williams. This includes drafts circulated under any title, including (but not limited to) "FCS Presidents Statement", "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory", and "COP Statement on HB 7".

7) Any records reflecting or relating to the review on or about January 2, 2023 by Chancellor Hebda of the FCS Presidents Statement.

8) Any emails to or from President Williams concerning the "Executive Order Framework" as referenced in her January 6, 2023 email.

9) Any records reflecting the submission of a statement on HB 7 on or about December 14, 2022, as referenced in President Williams' December 14, 2022 email with the subject line "COP Statement on HB 7".

10) Any records reflecting any response to the December 14, 2022 submission from any state official or appointee.

11) Any text messages sent to or from President Williams and any member of the Council of Presidents on or after November 1, 2022.

12) Any emails (including attachments), text messages, or other communications between President Williams on the one hand and either Chancellor Henry Mack or Chancellor Kathryn Hebda on the other hand on or after November 1, 2022.

13) Emails (including attachments) sent to or from Matthew Liao-Troth or Jamelle Connor on or after December 1, 2022 containing any of the "SEARCH TERMS" identified below.

14) Any emails sent to or from President Williams or any person employed within the college's media/public relations staff, on the one hand, and the Moore Agency (including Kendra or Karen Moore: kendrap@themooreagency.com, KarenM@themooreagency.com), on or after January 1, 2023. 

"SEARCH TERMS" means any of the following comma-delineated terms: HB7, HB 7, House Bill 7, Stop WOKE, Stop W.O.K.E., CRT, critical race theory, governor memorandum, executive order, 23-021, #23-021

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

The Office of the General Counsel at St. Petersburg College is in receipt of your below request for public records. We will begin the process of identifying and compiling the records. Please be advised that records shall only include records already created and/or maintained by St. Petersburg College, its agents or business affiliates.

The College’s institutional policy is to charge a statutory surcharge for records that require extensive use of information technology resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance by personnel in addition to the actual cost of duplication, pursuant to § 119.07, Fla. Stat.  The charge for print copies is 15 cents per one-sided copy.  Should the production of the request warrant a surcharge for use of information resources and/or extensive clerical or supervisory assistance, an estimate will be provided.

Please contact me if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

[cid:image001.png@01D94773.2227B8E0]
Mia Conza
General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
St. Petersburg College | SPC Downtown Center

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Ms. Conza --

Request Nos. 5, 11, 12, and 14 identify specific senders and recipients, the means of communication, and a limited range of dates of those communications. The requests are sufficient to objectively identify the requested records and are substantially narrower than request upheld in O'Boyle v. Town of Gulf Stream, 257 So. 3d 1036, 1042 (Fla. Dist. Ct. App. 2018). There, a requester sought "copies of text messages sent or received by the Town's Mayor since the time of his appointment." Id. at 1039. The court held that this was sufficient to establish a cause of action because it was, inter alia, "a specific request was made for all texts over a certain period of time." Id. at 1042. See also, e.g., State v. City of Clearwater, 863 So. 2d 149, 150 (Fla. 2003) (request for "all e-mails either sent from or received by two city employees over the City's computer network" over the course of one year).

Best,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Response to HB7, "Stop WOKE Act"
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

The College is in the process of compiling and reviewing the requested records. The voluminous number of records requested requires an extensive use of resources to comply. In addition, some of the information requested maintained in a format that is not readily available for production. Compiling this information requires a substantial amount of IT resources and labor costs to produce.  In accordance with 119.07, Fla. Stat., the estimate to review, redact, prepare, and produce the records is as follows:

  *   $64/hour x 16 hours = $1,024
  *   $157.50/hour x 15 hours = $2,362.50
  *   Total: $4,725

Please advise if you are willing to pay for the requested records. If you have any questions or need clarification, please let me know.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01D963C1.B91FFEA0]
Mia Conza
General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
St. Petersburg College | SPC Downtown Center

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Public information request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Request to obtain the salary that was earned by Manuel Navarro-Montero  since August 2021. To include any and all bonuses received. 

The employee was arrested for alleged sex offense that occurred between a female student at Meade High School.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M. W.

communications.communication:

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 147854
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

Delivered via email to  149309-82006415@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:149309-82006415@requests.muckrock.com>

Dear MuckRock News:

This communication is in response to your request under the Public Information Act, Annotated Code of Maryland, General Provisions Article (GP) §4-101, et seq., seeking information related to "salary that was earned by Manuel Navarro-Montero since August 2021. To include any and all bonuses received."

The information requested is listed below.

NAME

DATE RANGE

BONUS PAY

REGULAR PAY

TOTAL

NAVARRO MONTERO, MANUEL R

08/01/2021 - 07/12/2023

2000

141,891.45

143,891.45

 

In the event you disagree with any determination regarding this Maryland Public Information Act request, you have the right to seek review or remedy, in accordance with GP §4-1B-01 through §4-1B-04, with Maryland Public Access Ombudsman at PIA.Ombuds@oag.state.md.us and 410-576-6560, or by mail at the Office of the Attorney General, 200 St. Paul Place, Baltimore, MD 21202. Under GP §4-362, you also have the right to file a complaint in Circuit Court requesting a review of this decision.

 

If you have further questions, please feel free to contact me at 410-222-5312 or by email at piarequest@aacps.org.

Bob Mosier

Chief Communications Officer

title: Daniel Ellsberg records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg records (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records related to Daniel Ellsberg, the political activist, former US military analyst, and former RAND Corporation researcher employee who leaked the Pentagon Papers to the press in 1971. On June 16, 2023 he died: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/06/16/daniel-ellsberg-pentagon-papers-dead/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Micah Lee

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FACIAL RECOGNITION  SOFTWARE (San Bernardino County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FACIAL RECOGNITION  SOFTWARE (San Bernardino County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment in place with this department or agency. Please specify if software has been purchased or if services are performed by outside contractors for the department or agency.  Please include pilot or testing programs within the scope of this request.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of  Facial Recognition software packages, Facial Recognition-enabled equipment or service agreements.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment, including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment.


Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

communications.communication:
San Bernardino County ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #23-906 along with the following message: August 8, 2023 MuckRock News Attn: Aaron Swartz Re: Public Records Act request # 23-906 Dear Mr. Swartz: The San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department (“Department”) has concluded its review of your Public Records Act request. Your request seeks information relating to Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition equipment. The Department has located the attached documents, which may be responsive to your request. Redactions have been made pursuant to Government Code sections 7927.700, 7927.705 and 7922.000. In response to your request for any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Facial Recognition software or Facial Recognition-enabled equipment, the Department has conducted a thorough and diligent search and has determined that there has been none. Sincerely, San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE 21-22 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE 23-24 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS Sole Source 2022 Redacted.pdf * DATAWORKS MAINTENANCE Quote 38484 Redacted.pdf * CAL ID FACE REC Policy .pdf Document links are valid for one month. After September 8, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at San Bernardino County.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Azusa Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Law Request: Local level SAEC policies/data (Troy, NY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (1977 N.Y. Laws ch. 933), I hereby request the following records:

Any and all statistics, data, reports, audits, policies, and procedures pertaining to the following items regarding sexual assault evidence collection (SAEC) kits (also known as "rape kits") and processing:

• all standard operating procedures regarding the SAEC process

• any written policies or procedures regarding department practices on the acquisition of or handling of rape kit evidence, including protocols for its collection, testing, and delegation and transfer to all other possibly relevant locations, laboratories, or agencies

• the number of kits collected and booked into evidence from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of kits that have been processed by a public or private crime or forensic laboratory or equivalent processing location from the period of January 1, 2000 through the date this request is processed

• the number of unprocessed kits in any storage facilities currently under the department’s jurisdiction and control, including those held by medical personnel or at external laboratory locations

• any materials regarding the status or ultimate disposition of cases in which a kit was collected. Please include all available segregable data.

• all audits involving this agency regarding the collection or backlog of SAEC kits

• all proposed alterations or yet-to-be-implemented changes to the policies and procedures regarding the collection, testing, and use of SAEC kits

If there any questions about this request, please feel free to call us at the MuckRock office at 617-299-1832.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Vanessa Nason

communications.subject: City FOIL Request :: C005626-080823
communications.communication:
Dear Vanessa Nason: 

Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Troy, NY. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 8/8/2023 and given the reference number C005626-080823 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: "See Attached" 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. City of Troy FOIL Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6spZ3m7fqwo8Qb8g4E-2BoCGM7f-2FkiZ6tXREBYyDEN1oCFA-3D-3DIfL2_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjgaRNd1sUAnzyzMcMNvTkd69en4RWh2qBCfqvkwkvdtE3GQJV5-2Bvpy35sxWlwHwqgke3GLGNc2C0iuaw7DuaXkZt5T5b8aElYUJ35x5N-2BZM081FPP9AtNYoz44-2BbCsmPlCCxFqzy5iijoKv2USYZecyR-2BjzD-2B-2Fl-2FX1sQ2tEXzqWXGl0y3Ar-2BM0pl4NyaxhiAINSRaBFfMoRWvLLlSUOoJE56qnZK0P3R2mvpo-2F-2BTrSot0FZJ-2FL1IbHOSc-2BqcYvjuwZrG8CV31Y-2FL4wQctu6VckWz9-2Ba6XUi-2Fr8o01JcPi4lwACnHySzH-2B2n-2BcOcWCojYl8eKDn7AfvyP55C-2BbTrj8Vg-3D-3D)

communications.communication:
Dear Vanessa Nason, 
Thank you for registering with the City of Troy's FOIL Records Center. 
Your Login ID is:  48437-40106074@requests.muckrock.com 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6seBY0rXJ3PyX0ubgxm9P2yqiFbh4bV9ckc-2FECoR7870A-3D-3DgHD7_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjtthpcIrVQuDMRmWyqaNU5UTZ7c9dBY1n3v4tkB-2BBCCfZg-2F9itAyWXW13b4Z2t5rzUlImP2Nt6BqMwCQpSA-2F8B031Q-2Fqc3f9-2FgYfoPGQIT0TZjsqvH3aB0mS9bc8xPsGtM-2BHc0Qz2wJKu9bsFaDZryVfg0NJYSDibCK8xYv6fJgI-3D)

communications.subject: [Records Center] City FOIL Request :: C005626-080823
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL REQUEST of August 08, 2023., Reference # C005626-080823. 
Dear Vanessa Nason, 
My name is Frank and I started in the role of deputy director of public information in late March. 
I recently received a fax from a FOIL Officer within the Troy Police Department regarding this MuckRock FOIL case handled by one of my predecessors. 
They provided me with responsive documents and while I am told the documents were made available at the time, I am making them available again. My apologies if you did not receive these documents when the request was originally filed. 
Please click here to login and download the responsive records: My Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6tmEoB1sva0K-2FO96Sv560Nl3-2Fb-2BSI2XmCLGv9Y-2BRy7g2A-3D-3DEXAu_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjgaRNd1sUAnzyzMcMNvTkd-2FnuhyiEt-2BaX-2FzcGVnctDTKaTTMgdDEkq-2FqUSrp75-2BklVRF5-2FY9yfSqb2015yWZAm5YHL7xo-2FQ-2FEKK1-2F0x80vP-2FV-2FVFPd5ALCjXrfc4K6RxfdSEMsgv2PHObAU2X-2FyWrVd1zdA4pfhzG2y7qpCCErO6LsQ2sQlw3zdHw0zk8ivj3NWMS2t-2B77NMhYVm5Sk6S8Nb-2Fb5kfwfUtJenBQJqP3L1NBFODy0GYxZMVaN7HOPo05pC91eXOONhCwqu4VF62T2Bj1RB8WRPfjUEsMlsFVCuuBmif84BeuzCAgFstiN3f) 
Best, 
Frank 
### 
This request is hereby closed. Any persons who feel they have been denied access to requested records may appeal the decision in writing within thirty days. Appeals should be mailed to: Richard T. Morrissey, Office of the Corporation Counsel, Troy City Hall, 433 River Street, Troy, NY 12180. 

To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HYdxLOL2gU5oRgYdNVDNo6vTDL6Qc9e-2FDzVLfXF6X6pRxFGMPddsv7WN5HV47KY5T2iGGNBgAW6rfxC7zYgaff4-3Dabzy_qdvQVCWowAHpU54cRSj9g0poM8KwLK-2FvkCwaWYhINhgexm-2F-2F6LoIa8gXZbptbGVjgaRNd1sUAnzyzMcMNvTkd-2FnuhyiEt-2BaX-2FzcGVnctDTKaTTMgdDEkq-2FqUSrp75-2BklVRF5-2FY9yfSqb2015yWZAm5YHL7xo-2FQ-2FEKK1-2F0x80vP-2FV-2FVFPd5ALCjXrfc4K6RxfdSEMsgv2PHObAU2X-2FyWrVd1zdA4pfhzG2y7qpCCErO6BW52dvDOxPANTcvFs9qR2QzAEfYNCIllzN1-2FAEfysY0gnVSwYjgM3eyplw756zIL7qeqRMk-2FaldkcmAgal-2FJaTVXERQxGrHaqv7BKIj3T4gKADKhoNIZsrQHPCzkjEouh37qgScKI6hQALyK7gOOP)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2018 EPA Radnet reporting Boise, ID
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, documents, correspondence, materials, presentations, reports, and data concerning missing/unreported RadNet system data from stationary air monitors located in Boise, ID between November 15, 2018, and November 27, 2018.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grant Michael Hill

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Grant Michael Hill

title: FWS drone footage from flights as part of "Operation Border Surge"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FWS drone footage from flights as part of "Operation Border Surge"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all video footage from drone flights from July 26, 2018 through August 7, 2018 as part of "Operation Border Surge."

This missions were disclosed in a log of unmanned aerial vehicle missions released via a previous FOIA request. The remote pilot in command is listed as Shay Hurd.  The log lists the RID's as:
